content.label: Occasionally a small bug will sneak up, but nothing to deter the fun

The game warns you up front that you will die, a lot. This is true, and it will be in the same dungeon over snd over and over. While the game is fun at first, it becomes too repetitive just to collect coin to build your mansion stats to finally get higher. I have probably fought the.p cow dungeon 30-40 times already just farming money, without a chance to win that particular dungeon yet and yet there is no way to replay a dungeon after you beat it.

I have an iPhone 6S Plus and when playing in portrait mode the picture is cut off at the edges of the screen. The game's still playable and it doesn't obstruct any of the game's functions but it can be distracting sometimes. The game is also playable in landscape mode but the text and buttons are too small for a successful play session. Other than that, this is an excellent game and is well worth the price. It's not "luck based" as some reviews have said. It's risk/reward based. The types of advantages you get all depend on the amount of risk you're willing to take. Great game.

The game is ok. Been having it for awhile and it don't seem they will ever fix the issue with trying to clear a spell crashing the game (leaving it completely frozen and unresponsive) forcing you to redo everything you did in that dungeon.  I like the setup of the game and the little odds and ends you can grab from the hideout though. Good ideas here, but please fix this spell issue
A little buggy but lots of fun. Bugs don't stop game play. A lot more challenging than previous.
Disappointed
Title says it all.

title.label: We need more type of this game

content.label:
I love dungeon crawler game
I hope there are more in the appstore not some inapp purchase fale dungeon crawler

Was enjoying this little clicky roguelike until I realized how buggy it was. I'm not upset by some balloons/windows opening behind other ones, but I *am* upset that two classes (Paladin and Bard) are nerfed because "self healing" spells do not, in fact, heal the character.

Game is great but sometimes selecting a spell freezes the game preventing you from finishing the map. The nice part is that the game saves your progress (from the very beginning) but having to restart and play the same map gets old really fast. Would be a 5/5 but this bug dampens the mood to play.
Lots of strategy involved.
Great just fix bugs please!
Is game is fun & easy to play.  For a quick dungeon crawling fix, this game is well worth your time & money.
Though game is most difficult I ever played.

title.label: A grinding game where your character never improves

content.label: Graphics and basic gameplay are very good, but after a while I just gave up.  It's a grinding kind of game, but there is no leveling up.  After a few hours of play (I got my money's worth), I just got bored of making no progress and uninstalled it.

This is largely a fun game, but there are crashes related to animations and changing levels which are very annoying

The witch portrayal is a tad stereotypical anime girlie girl, but still worth a play.
Dungeons start to feel the same after a while, a little more variety is needed.
It's the perfect risk reward game and brutally hard but unfortunately, it crashes. Fix this and I recommend this to anyone!!!
I get stuck in third level,bad balabce
I like your game

title.label: Don't buy. Front end good, back end bad

content.label:
Smooth animations, good graphics, storyline and character development mehhh. Bugs. All listed within other reviews. Text behind ui, freezing after no target available for spells. Text off screen.  Dodge and chance gets a bit skewed later in the game. 

All in all tiny got their money and have no desire to fix seemingly easy issues.
This game crashed twice just in 15 mins.

Ultimately, the RNG and lack of late game progression got to me. There were also occasional crashes and UI issues (eg, unresponsive to touch) that should have been patched along the way. I would not purchase this title again. Better roguelikes on iOS include, in no particular order, Crypt of the Necrodancer, Sproggiwood, 868-HACK, Imbroglio, Dream Quest, Downwell, Wayward Souls, Don't Starve, etc.

title.label: Didn't seem like much at first...

content.label: But it's a lot of fun and very addictive! No regrets with this purchase.
This is a very well done game. And refreshing with three pay once model
Despite a view visual bugs and a couple crashes occurring, this game is fun, challenging, and engaging. It's simple yet very rewarding to get through a whole dungeon
Seriously it's awesome!

This is a really fun game, but it keeps crashing. I've played it about 12 times and it has crashed at least 8 out of the 12. But it's fun, hence the 4 stars, but I won't buy the next one unless they fix this one first.
Oh baby, I've found the perfect game to ignore my family with this holiday. I would remove a star for the cheesy jokes, but the mechanics are fantastic.
Couple bugs mentioned in other reviews. Occasionally die without knowing why...probably my fault
Strangely addictive. Super fun!
Challenge level is solid - I see some reviews complain about the difficulty, but you need to play smart and not try to kill every monster.  I'm having a great time and really enjoying this title.

title.label: Addictive super polished and well designed

content.label:
Very well designed quick to pick up and play rogue like.

Really cool art style and has a super fun loop.
A Good App!
Fun game that you don't have to drop 100s of dollars into to be good.
Doog

I've continued to give this game a chance but it is incredibly cheap. By the time you're near a boss the game will simply hammer you with ridiculous enemies until you die. I like a challenge but this is just cheap.

I was a fan of the free to play Dungelot games, so I bought this one, but I wish I hadn't. I'm stuck on the third dungeon, right at the beginning of the game. No matter how many times I try, I can only get through about half the floors in either of the unlocked dungeons. I've bought all the weapons and armor, and they do not help. Really poor game design and balance.
Editors choice for a reason. Always find myself going back to play.

Even on enemies that say they have a 15% dodge chance, I'm missing six and seven times in a row. That's just absurd. Something is way out of whack with either the dodge mechanic or miss chance.

Also, there seems to be a bug that crashes the game if you attack immediately after throwing an ice bomb.

First off the move to paid is SO much better. 2nd, there's hardly any equipment to find, and the ones u do find don't show on ur character.  Could have been the only quick-play rpg I'd ever play.  Too boring and short lived for me to keep playing.  Sequel should have a ton of customization, otherwise the gameplay is amazing.

I love the first two, and decided to immediately purchase this without thinking twice. While this sequel certainly is a lot more elaborate, it's painfully difficult. The addiction level is high at first, until you realize you're starting the same dungeons over and over and over relying on pure luck. It winds up being no better than a slot machine. I remember they were complaints that the first one was too easy. Now it went far in the opposite direction.
Nice turn based game that is fairly straightforward but keeps throwing new twists at you.

I really liked the first one, but they've really gone above and beyond here. 

First one was a fun time waster, this one feels like a more complete game.

Amazing follow up to the original. Allows for multiple game play environment and problem solving. A little buggy when casting spells but otherwise a solid work. Forces you to vary your characters and analyze each scenario differently. Easy to become hooked. Definitely worth the money.

title.label: Enjoying this luck based and somewhat buggy game

content.label: I finally got around to picking this game up. Definitely enjoying it. I can see how the luck can work against you, but it doesn't take away from the fun. The bugs do, however. It's crashed on me once and twice it has stopped responding to my touch - in about 30 minutes of gameplay. Luckily it saves where you left off for the most part.

title.label: Odd at first, but yes, strangely addictive

content.label:
System is interesting, not too complicated to learn, yes, luck definitely can make or break you, but there are also many points at which your decisions do make a difference.

Style is fun, nice bits of humor in the dialogue.

Easy to pick up and play for a short period.

I've not run into any of the issues others have cited thus far, other than the dialogue box overlap.

Overall, very well done.
Though a lot more complicated

Bugs include: word balloons showing up behind UI (namely goblin shops), crashing after death stats appear (I'm on an iPhone 6s, so.... not the hardware), unable to progress if you load a game wherein you didn't pass the first dungeon. // all of those are OK, a little annoying for a paid game (all of those mentioned bugs are CONSISTENT, not one-offs or anomalies), but they're bearable. The game itself is part strategy, part luck. Sometimes the luck is REALLY skewed against you, to a degree that it takes the fun out of it. The more you grind (and it is a grindfest) the better chance you have of countering any bad luck, but there's no guarantee. The story is barely there, so I hope you don't pick this up for that. All in all, this is an OK game that, because there's a luck element involved, isn't crazy fun, just average.
A little bit laggy at times but still good
